poem:
**The Unwed Song**

In the fluted villages of jade and steel,  
where moon-bride tales have dimmed to whispers,  
young hearts fold maps, defying ancestral scripts.  
Against the frail usher of time and womb,  
a new rhythm beats—a single note, bold—  
favoured pulse of the modern tune,  
where "no" finds its voice amidst the old.
